relation: The campus has great security guards. They give you their phone number and when ever you do not feel safe or need a ride, they will be more than willing to drive their golf carts over to you. They are a 24 hour service.
LC always has something on campus to do. We usually have concerts. In our planner, we have small statements of what is happening that day.

Food is always up for grabs at LC. We have the cafeteria (which always takes reccomendations), Westover (a great hangout area as well as great wraps and grilled items), and Roly Poly (a wonderful place to hang out and play some pool and snack on a wrap).
The dorms at Lynchburg College are mostly central. They are all near the Dell which is the center point of the campus. Thus, repetitively close to all of the classrooms.

If you ever struggle with a class and need help, we have a PASS program for tutoring as well as tutoring sessions you can sign up for free of purchase. You also have office hours given to you by the professors and all of them will work with you to find a time for an appointment.
Some tips I would recommend for prospective students are to stay true to yourself and to stand strong for what you believe. With this, you would fit right in.
Lynchburg College is life changing. I am fighting to stay in this college as I type. It is the best college I could ever ask to attend.

Tips for prospective students Make sure you really want a small school; this means smaller, more personalized classes but it also means more homework because teachers are able to grade more work with a smaller class load. Also, make sure this school has your major before deciding to attend. Even if you are only vaguely interested in something, make sure the school has it. You don't want to get somewhere and then realize you need to transfer; it's a difficult process. Try to get into the Westover Honor Society; it really pays off! Bang for the buck LC offers great scholarships, especially for in-state residents. Make sure you keep pushing the Financial Aid office looking for more scholarships; usually they will offer more if you insist. For the price of the school (or any price really), you are getting a great education. Am enjoying being here The people at LC are very friendly and open. Because the campus is relatively small (about 2,000 undergrads), it's hard to walk anywhere without seeing someone you know. Am learning a lot
